page.title: 05PRESTON GUILD
page.content: The Preston Guild is a festival to commemorate a meeting where a stock_taking took place. The first Guild was held in 1328. Since the 16th Century, it had been a rule that the Guild Merchant should take place every 20 years commencing on the Monday following the Feast of the beheading of St.John. The first Guild this Century was in 1902. There was no Guild in 1942 because of World War II. In 1952 thousands turned out to a reception by the Mayor. Processions go through the streets of Preston for a week. The Guild Hall was built for the 1972 Guild when Concorde flew over. During this 1972 Guild, a large fair was held on Moor Park. A schools' festival presented "Camelot" and "Prospect of Preston". The next Guild will take place in 1992.
